p: In clinical trials of COVID-19, it would not be ethical to exclude patients with comorbidities, for example, hypertension and diabetes mellitus or restrict concomitant treatment, which could be part of standard care for SARS, for example, oxygen, noninvasive and invasive ventilation, antibiotics, vasopressor support, renal replacement, corticosteroids, and extracorporeal membrane oxygen.[ 1]
